info.name: Snowflake Stream API
info.description:
The Snowflake Stream API is a REST API that you can use to access, update, and perform certain actions on Stream resource in a Snowflake database.

Contact Support:
 Name: Snowflake, Inc.
 Email: support@snowflake.com

variable.description: Identifier (i.e. name) for the database to which the resource belongs. You can use the `/api/v2/databases` GET request to get a list of available databases.
Identifier (i.e. name) for the schema to which the resource belongs. You can use the `/api/v2/databases/{database}/schemas` GET request to get a list of available schemas for the specified database.

response.name: successful
Successfully accepted the request, but it is not completed yet.

Bad Request. The request payload is invalid or malformed. This happens if the application didn't send the correct request payload. The response body may include the error code and message indicating the actual cause. The application must reconstruct the r

Unauthorized. The request is not authorized. This happens if the attached access token is invalid or missing. The response body may include the error code and message indicating the actual cause, e.g., expired, invalid token. The application must obtain a
Forbidden. The request is forbidden. This can also happen if the request is made even if the API is not enabled.
Not Found. The request endpoint is not valid. This happens if the API endpoint does not exist, or if the API is not enabled.
Method Not Allowed. The request method doesn't match the supported API. This happens, for example, if the application calls the API with GET method but the endpoint accepts only POST.
Request Timeout. This indicates that the request from the client timed out and was not completed by the server.

Conflict. The requested operation could not be performed due to a conflicting state that could not be resolved. This usually happens when a CREATE request was performed when there is a pre-existing resource with the same name, and also without one of the
Gone. This error is primarily intended to assist the task of web maintenance by notifying the recipient that the resource is intentionally unavailable.
Limit Exceeded. The number of requests hit the rate limit. The application must slow down the frequency of hitting the API endpoints.

Internal Server Error. The server hit an unrecoverable system error. The response body may include the error code and message for further guidance. The application owner may need to reach out the customer support.
Service Unavailable. The request was not processed due to server side timeouts. The application may retry with backoff. The jittered backoff is recommended.
Gateway Timeout. The request was not processed due to server side timeouts. The application may retry with backoff. The jittered backoff is recommended.

query.description:
Parameter that specifies how to handle the request for a resource that does not exist:
- `true`: The endpoint does not throw an error if the resource does not exist. It returns a 200 success response, but does not take any action on the resource.
- `false`: The endpoint throws an error if the resource doesn't exist.

variable.description: Identifier (i.e. name) for the database to which the resource belongs. You can use the `/api/v2/databases` GET request to get a list of available databases.
Identifier (i.e. name) for the schema to which the resource belongs. You can use the `/api/v2/databases/{database}/schemas` GET request to get a list of available schemas for the specified database.

response.name: Successful request.

Parameter allowing support for different modes of resource creation. Possible values include:
- `errorIfExists`: Throws an error if you try to create a resource that already exists.
- `orReplace`: Automatically replaces the existing resource with the current one.
- `ifNotExists`: Creates a new resource when an alter is requested for a non-existent resource.
Database of the target resource. Defaults to the source's database
Schema of the target resource. Defaults to the source's schema
Parameter to enable copy grants when creating the object.

Parameter to filter the command output by resource name. Uses case-insensitive pattern matching, with support for SQL wildcard characters.
Parameter to filter the command output based on the string of characters that appear at the beginning of the object name. Uses case-sensitive pattern matching.
Parameter to limit the maximum number of rows returned by a command.
Parameter to enable fetching rows only following the first row whose object name matches the specified string. Case-sensitive and does not have to be the full name.

Parameter allowing support for different modes of resource creation. Possible values include:
- `errorIfExists`: Throws an error if you try to create a resource that already exists.
- `orReplace`: Automatically replaces the existing resource with the current one.
- `ifNotExists`: Creates a new resource when an alter is requested for a non-existent resource.
Parameter to enable copy grants when creating the object.

variable.description: Identifier (i.e. name) for the database to which the resource belongs. You can use the `/api/v2/databases` GET request to get a list of available databases.
Identifier (i.e. name) for the schema to which the resource belongs. You can use the `/api/v2/databases/{database}/schemas` GET request to get a list of available schemas for the specified database.

response.name: Successful request.

Parameter to enable copy grants when creating the object.
